fields.description:
How can we facilitate/make quicker prioritization on issues within the scrumboad?

Now we use a quick filter to sort out all issues that not yet have a prio set and then do the following:

*Right click and open in a separate window
*Set prio
*Minimize window
*Then do the same with next issue
*When all issues have a prio set go to scrum board window and press F5 to update
*Close all new open windows

This consumes a lot of time. Why can´t we just click on the prio icon and get a list of options in the list of issues in the backlog or in the current sprint in case we need to change the prio?
fields.summary: Speedier prioritization of issues in scrum board

fields.description:
How can we facilitate/make quicker prioritization on issues within the scrumboad?

Now we use a quick filter to sort out all issues that not yet have a priority set and then do the following:

# Right click and open in a separate window
# Set Priority
# Minimize window
# Then do the same with next issue
# When all issues have a priority set go to Scrum Board window and press *F5* to update
# Close all new open windows

This consumes a lot of time. Why can´t we just click on the prio icon and get a list of options in the list of issues in the backlog or in the current sprint in case we need to change the priority?
fields.summary: Speedier prioritization of issues in scrum board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently you can only generate one epic burndown or epic report from a single epic

h3. Suggested Solution
Create ability to combine multiple reports into one, so for example, to get information on a single project with multiple epics
fields.summary: I would like to combine multiple epics into one burndown or epic report

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently you can only generate one epic burndown or epic report from a single epic

h3. Suggested Solution
Create ability to combine multiple reports into one, so for example, to get information on a single project with multiple epics
fields.summary: I would like to combine multiple epics into one burndown or epic report

fields.description:
We are very used to use swimlanes based on userstories. In addition to that, we would like to use a swimlane which contains all impedimients that occur during a sprint. 
At the moment, what we currently are able to do in JIRA is either to have swimlanes for all userstories with their subtasks or a swimlane which catches the impediments of all userstories (priority=blocker). In the latter case we use JQL for defining the swimlane. But when using swimlanes based on JQL queries, we are not able to have swimlanes for all userstories too. 


Having the ability to add an impediment swimlane above the userstory swimlanes would be great
fields.summary: Having the ability to add an impediment swimlane above the userstory swimlanes

fields.description:
Hi,

it would be really awesome to see created agile boards in the project administration backend (see attachment). This would help us alot to find agile boards which are connected with a project and also which have names which don't fit with an internal naming convention. 

Best Regards,
Jan (Goodgame Studios)
fields.summary: link agile boards with project administration backend

fields.description:
We can configure the columns available in the 'subtasks' section of an issue, but can we also configure the columns available in the 'Issues in Epic' section of an epic?
We'd like to add story points when we display an epic
fields.summary: On epics, we would like the ability to configure the columns shown in the 'Issues in Epic' section.

fields.description:
User would like the Remaining and Estimate information at the bottom of an active sprint on the backlog as displayed for an inactive sprint on the blacklog.

At the moment,  Summary is available only for next/future sprints. 

!backlog.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Display remaining time summary for active sprint in Backlog (Scrum Board)

fields.description:
h3. *Current Behavior*
* If you have an agile board open in one browser tab and open another agile board/project in different browser tab, returning to the first opened agile board and clicking *Create Issue* results in the default/selected value of a project to be from the second opened agile board/project. It defaults the project to the last viewed project. 

Example:
* 1. Open a Scrum board (ex: SUPPORT BOARD that filters issues from a project called SUPPORT (SUPP))
* 2. In another browser tab, open up an issues from a different project (ex: PROD-205)
* 3. Switch back to the tab containing the Scrum board.
* 4. Click Create and the Create Issue screen now contains the default/selected value of PRODUCTION (PROD)

* *Only thing that resolves this is by refreshing current page*

h3. *Tested In*
* {{JIRA v6.5-OD-05-041}} in {{Chrome Version 42.0.2311.135 (64-bit)}},{{Safari Version 8.0.6 (10600.6.3)}}, and {{Firefox 38.0.5}}

h3. *Suggestion*
* The ability for when clicking *Create Issue* that the default value for Project in the Create Issue Screen to accurately reflect that current project/board
fields.summary: Create Issue On Agile Board Should Default To Current Project
list of active sprint on rest api should exclude closed/deleted sprint

fields.description:
Currently, only the issues are counted on the total number of issues assigned.

!Screen Shot 2015-06-11 at 10.29.18 AM.png!
fields.summary: Count the sub-tasks when hover the mouse on the user's picture on horizontal list of assignees of the sprint

fields.description: On Agile boards in Plan mode, there is a slider to resize the detail view.  This is not available in Work mode, in either Agile or Kanban view.  I understand that in most cases, having a lot of columns in Work mode means this wouldn't be helpful, but we have several use cases, including kanban boards with only one or two columns, where this would be very helpful.  Please add this ability, even if there is some limitation based on number of columns to what the maximum size might be.
fields.summary: Add Resize Detail View slider to Work mode

fields.description: Currently, the burndown chart can be added to Confluence page via the Sprint Burndown gadget, but many of the other reports cannot. It would be great to provide gadgets (or some other form of Confluence integration) for these reports.
fields.summary: Provide Confluence integration for all the Agile reports

fields.description:
Hi,

our problem is related to the GHS-11006 issue:

if we try to update the Sprint field during a bulk change using the sprint name we got the error: 
*Sprint id must be a number:* 

You said it has been fixed in AGILE 6.6.0 but we still face this problem in AGILE 6.6.8

I know there is a workaround for how to get the sprint ID but it just makes no sense. We should be able to use the sprint name for the change not the sprint ID.

Please have a look on this issue.

if you need more information (logs, etc) do not hesitate to contact me.

Thank you!

Regards,
Csaba
fields.summary: Cannot bulk edit Sprint field

fields.description:
Currently flagging an issue in a board triggers the "Issue Updated" event which we can notify users through the project's notification scheme.

Problem is that the Issue Updated event is also triggered by most of the changes made to issues, which can cause a lot of undesired notifications.

It would be great if we could have a separate option to notify only the "Flagged" action.
fields.summary: As a user I want to be notified on flagging issues
Can you please advise as to why the Fix Version on Issues is now not displaying on the Development board

fields.description:
It appears that JIRA Agile Gadgets does not work when using IE9, although the IE9 browser is listed as a supported platform:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Supported+Platforms

IE9 should be removed from supported platforms as the gadgets will not work when using this browser.
fields.summary: Update JIRA Agile Supported Platforms doc

fields.description:
When a sprint is open, we can select a start date. This date can be in the future and after the issue is actually opened. 

When completing and issue, JIRA automatically records the 'Complete Date' as the current date. We are able to complete the sprint before the 'Start Date', having and issue started after it was completed, which doesn't make sense. 

Also, the 'Start Date' and 'Complete Date' are shown in some reports (not the 'End Date'), as the sprint duration. For example, the 'Release burndown' report, that show sprints with a misleading date information.

The 'Complete Date' is not to be mistaken with the 'End Date', which is automatically set based on the sprint duration and it always after the 'Start Date'.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create a sprint in a board
# Start the sprint with 'Start Date' some time in the future
# Complete the sprint

*Expected Behavior*
* Start Date before Complete Date is enforced, for example, prompting the user for a new 'Start Date'

*Actual Outcome*
* The 'Complete Date' is set before the 'Start Date'
* This is visible in some reports and in the database
fields.summary: Sprint Start Date can be later than Complete Date

fields.description: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/JIRA+Agile+6.7.4+Release+Notes
fields.summary: page restrictions are set on release notes JIRA Agile 6.7.4

fields.description: Even though JIRA Agile Java API is the only one that's [officially supported|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/api-reference/jira-agile-api-reference], there is no documentation or example showing how to access various components contained within it like for example SprintManager and all the examples on Answers look like hacks.
fields.summary: Document how to use Java API

fields.description:
Agile boards use Saved Filters to determine their content.
It is possible to delete a Saved Filter without realising it will affect boards that depend on it.
There should be a warning or similar so the user is aware of this.
fields.summary: Warn when deleting a Saved Filter if Agile boards are using it

fields.description:
I would like the ability to quickly switch the grouping of swim lanes on the agile board by user, project, component or any other value. The only way I see is to configure the board but I don't want the setting to be visible for all users. 

This feature would be very useful in my role as scrum master where I have to track progress for different users, projects or components.
fields.summary: Ability to temporarily change grouping of swim lanes by different values without configuring board

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Control Chart only shows data for issues that have been in a selected column but are no longer in a selected column

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Install JIRA [Suite Utilities|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.googlecode.jira-suite-utilities] before hand so that you will be able to view the Transitions panel on issue view screen. 

# Create an Agile Scrum Project
# Create a Sprint
# Create an issue and put in in the Sprint then start the Sprint 
# On the issue itself, wait for 3 mins then transition from To Do -> In Progress 
# From the Status In Progress , wait another 2 mins then transition In Progress -> In Progress
# From the Status in Progress, wait another 2 mins then transition In progress -> Done
# Go to the board > Reports > Select Control Chart > Select All Columns 
# Click on the issue on the chart and it will only show the time cycle for in
{quote}
* To Do = 3m
* In Progress = 2m
* Cycle Time = 5m
!loop1.png|thumbnail!
{quote}
# It neglects the cycle time spent from in Progress -> In Progress and the Total cycle time should be 7 mins. 
# The In progress -> In Progress cycle time which is 2 mins can be seen from the Transition Panel using the JIRA Suit Utilities. 
!loop2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
Should include Cycle Time for status transitioning to itself ( In Progress -> In Progress )
* !loop2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
Does not include Cycle Time for status transitioning to itself ( In Progress -> In Progress )
* !loop1.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
This is actually an expected behavior according to the [Control Chart|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Viewing+the+Control+Chart] documentation :
{quote}
For example, if you are using the JIRA Software Development workflow, you may consider work to have started on an issue when it transitions to 'In Progress' and work to have completed when it transitions out of 'In Review' (to 'Done'). You would show this on the Control Chart by selecting 'In Progress' and 'In Review' as the Columns, as that would show the time that issues have spent in those two statuses.

Tip 3: Exclude current work
The Control Chart shows data for issues that have been in a selected column but are no longer in a selected column. This gives the cycle time (total elapsed time) for the issues. However, by default this will include issues which are still moving across the board.
To view the data for completed work only in your Control Chart, create a Quick Filter with this JQL: status in (Resolved, Closed). Configure your Control Chart to use this Quick Filter.
{quote}

h3.Workaround
Do not transition to the same status. Create a dummy status to transition to. 
For example instead of In Progress -> In Progress , create another status in the workflow called In Progress 2. Then transition In Progress -> In Progress 2.
fields.summary: Display calculation of Cycle Time for Status Transitioning to Itself on JIRA Control Chart

fields.description: When you create a sprint from the backlog issues, the estimate is calculated underneath. Would it be possible to calculate an estimate for the remaining tickets in the backlog, which are not yet assigned to a sprint?
fields.summary: Calculate estimate total under backlog

fields.description:
I am surprised to see that is not possible to use the column constraints to limit what can be added to the columns based on a numeric field, like effort, story points!!!! ... or any numeric field.

Having a limitation on the number of issues limits this feature in a serious way.
fields.summary: Agile column constraints should work on numberic custom fields

fields.description:
I am surprised to see that is not possible to use the column constraints to limit what can be added to the columns based on a numeric field, like effort, story points!!!! ... or any numeric field.

Having a limitation on the number of issues limits this feature in a serious way.
fields.summary: Agile column constraints should work on numberic custom fields

fields.description:
Hi Team,

I want to fetch and show Burndown Charts from Jira Agile in my project site.

Any help ???
fields.summary: Jira Agile SDK to programmatically create Burndown Charts

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When viewing a project within JIRA, the 'Versions' tab on the left hand menu does not show up. When viewing issues within the backlog of the project, there is no 'version tag' within the issue description.


h3. *Environment*

This appears to be happening in environments running JIRA v6.5-OD-05-041


h3. *Steps to Reproduce*

# Log into Cloud instance
# Select a project that has versions configured
# Attempt to click on versions within the left hand menu
## The 'versions' menu item is missing
# Attempt to view the version listing in the backlog issue description
## The 'version tag' is not visible


h3. *Expected Results*

'Versions' should be viewable / clickable in the left hand manu
The 'version tag' should be viewable on the issue description when looking at issues in the backlog


h3. Actual Results

Neither of the above mentioned are viewable

 
h3. *Notes*

This appears to have started over the weekend when customers were updated to JIRA v6.5-OD-05-041


h3. *Workaround*

If the customer has no board configured they will not see the versions tab
If a customer views the Agile board associated with the project, they should see the 'versions' tab on the left hand side along with 'epics'
fields.summary: Versions unable to be viewed within projects

fields.description:
*Summary*
After the last release, versions are not showing on Versions panel.

*Steps to reproduce*
- Go to the Agile board and click the _Versions_ panel

*Expected Result*
- Version are displayed

*Current Result*
- Version are not showing but still visible on the _Releases_ ({{https://<instance-name>/projects/<Project Key>?selectedItem=com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:release-page}})
fields.summary: Versions are not showing on the Version panel
Buttons in top right of board have incorrect spacing and height

fields.description:
At the moment, in the Agile board, users can see the total number of issues (parent issues + sub-tasks) for every column, as shown in the screenshot below
!no.png|thumbnail!

It would be great to have the option to show the number of sub-tasks only.
fields.summary: Having the option to show number (on the top of the column) for Subtask only

fields.description: The report shows Sprints that are not related with any issue within the Epic.
fields.summary: Epic Burndown

fields.description:
I'm Product Owner, and *in order to have a better view of my road map, I have always several sprints* :
- Current Sprint (called Sprint 65 for example)
- Next Sprints (my 2-3 next sprints)
- Current Release Backlog
- Potential for the Current Release Backlog
and the rest is in Backlog.

It means that, after each sprint, I close the current sprint, I create a new one, and I need to rename all of them because I want that my new sprint appears always at the top.

So I'd like to create a sprint and move it as I wish on my Agile View so that I can create a sprint at the top or between two others when I have many sprints, or maybe create a sprint at the top is enough, or create a sprint between two others.
fields.summary: As a project manager I want to be able to create a sprint and move it as I wish on my Agile View so that I can create a sprint at the top or between two others when I have many sprints

fields.description: As a Agile user I would like the option to be able to remove / disable the avatar from being displayed in the agile card view on my board.
fields.summary: As a Agile user I would like to be able to remove the avatar from the agile card

fields.description:
The "send to top" and "send to bottom" buttons are useful to some extent, but for moving a task up or down one or two slots, it seems the mouse is needed.

It would be great to be able to go to a task with the (j, k) buttons, then move it up or down, perhaps with shift+(j, k).
fields.summary: Keyboard Shortcut to move tasks in Backlog

fields.description:
The "send to top" and "send to bottom" buttons are useful to some extent, but for moving a task up or down one or two slots, it seems the mouse is needed.

It would be great to be able to go to a task with the (j, k) buttons, then move it up or down, perhaps with shift+(j, k).
fields.summary: Keyboard Shortcut to move tasks in Backlog

fields.description:
JIRA v6.4.4
JIRA Agile v6.7.2

Pre condidtion:
parent items can have multiple kinds of subtasks below them e.g. type 1 , type 2 type 3
Parent A
  subtask Type1
  subtask Type2
  subtask Type3

Create a scrum board to only show subtasks of type 2 by adding the filter query
 "project = ABC AND Issuetype=type2"

Steps to re produce:
1) log into the scrum board
2) transition the subtask of type 2 to done
result: board asks you to close the parent 
Bug: there are other subtasks of type 1 & type 3 still open under the parent the pop up should not be showing up
fields.summary: scrum board closes parent while subtasks are open (described below)

fields.description:
Pre condidtion:
parent items can have multiple kinds of subtasks below them e.g. type 1 , type 2 type 3
Parent A
  subtask Type1
  subtask Type2
  subtask Type3

Create a scrum board to only show subtasks of type 2 by adding the filter query
 "project = ABC AND Issuetype=type2"

Steps to re produce:
1) log into the scrum board
2) transition the subtask of type 2 to done
result: board asks you to close the parent 
Bug: there are other subtasks of type 1 & type 3 still open under the parent the pop up should not be showing up
fields.summary: scrum board closes parent while subtaks are open (described below)

fields.description:
We are blocked from closing sprints by 2 serious bugs:
1. Although the user is a project admin for all projects on our instance, they still cannot complete a sprint. 
2. The error message that comes up does not reflect the projects of issues actually on the Agile board, or any linked issues. Example: I get the error message "To update this sprint you must have Project Administrator permissions for all of the following projects: X, Y, Z, A" when the Agile board in question only filters for issues project = A.

I have already troubleshot the issue as follows. Nothing here worked: https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=298978639

This is severely impacting our work management process, as project managers cannot close sprints.
fields.summary: Cannot close sprint even though I am project admin for all projects

fields.description:
In our environment, it's possible that there could be thousands of "Sprint 1" sprints. Users are wishing to include the unique sprintID as an exportable column so that they can use that data in an Excel spreadsheet export of results. Currently, if you search for a SprintID it will resolve to the friendly name. This is great, and very useful. But there are times when retrieving the unique sprintID would be helpful. Exporting, for these users. But also when trying to find errant issue association to a sprint via the sprintID so that we know what sprint to provide in a bulk edit. Currently, you can find it but you have to hover over links and things and that's not terribly intuitive for some users.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Export SprintID along with friendly Sprint name

fields.description: Currently the JIRA Agile only shows unreleased versions. An option to select and show released versions can also be there. The goal is to be able to use the JIRA Agile to track the version and select issues from released versions too.
fields.summary: Provide Option To Display Released Versions With The JIRA Agile
quickFilter behaving strangely in Chrome

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-12090].
  {panel}

When a version is deleted from the project, issues that used to be on this version do have *fixVersion* set to *None*, but the issue history does not display any entries related to this.

It is a problem when users want to filter issues without versions on Agile boards. Issues that used to be on a version that has been deleted do not show up when we filter by *Issues without version*.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# create an Agile project
# create an issue on this project
# create a version on this project
# add this version to the fixVersion field of the issue
# delete the version
# go to the Agile board, expand *Versions* tab and click on *Issues without versions*

h4. Expected Behaviour:
the issue should be displayed on the Backlog

h4. Actual Behaviour:
the issue is NOT displayed on the Backlog
fields.summary: Deleting a Version does not update issue history

fields.description:
As a Scrum Master I would like to make a JQL query for cycle time so I can automate dashboards and metrics for management.

Cycle time metrics are the one place where teams can see how long things linger at various statuses -- and make corrections.  Visibility of cycle times is important for enterprise management.
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master I would like to make a JQL query for cycle time so I can automate dashboards and metrics for management.

fields.description:
As a Scrum Master I would like to make a JQL query for team velocity so I can query for closed Sprints and then take average Story Points for past few sprints. 

This would allow me to make relevant automatically updated dashboard for management reports, and JIRA filter reports in Confluence.
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master I would like to make a JQL query for team velocity so can query for closed Sprints and then take average Story Points for past few sprints.

fields.description:
Users can re-arrange the order of sub-tasks in the parent's issue. However, this order cannot be reflected in the Agile board (active sprint mode). As the order in Agile board is based on their ranks. 

Having the ability for the Agile Board (Active Sprint) to follow/reflect Subtasks' order in Parent's issue would be great to ease the users, instead of having to reorder it manually at the board side.
fields.summary: Having the ability for the Agile Board (Active Sprint) to follow Subtasks order in Parent's issue

fields.description:
We have 2 use cases for Agile boards when it comes to assigning issues:
1) a person takes an issue from the To-Do list and put it in progress
2) in a standup meeting, 1 person controlling the screen assigns issues to members of the team.
We have a problem with user case 2 in that issues are assigned to the person dragging them on the board. I understand the reason behind this, because it supports use case 1 and this is true Agile. However, I believe there are many Agile teams in the world working according to use case 2. So I am proposing to give the user the option as to which use case should be active, perhaps we need a Standup button next to the Work button, so Work supports use case 1 and Standup use case 2.
fields.summary: add Standup mode to distribute issues to a team
Having an option for the sprint fields to NOT be automatically added into Screens whenever a new project is created and enabled for Agile

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to Board -> Configure -> Columns
2. Try to drag a status between columns.
fields.summary: Tooltips stick around when moving statuses between columns in the column configuration

fields.description:
If the user adds the URL custom field to the card layout, then we currently show the url as a clickable link. This causes confusion. We should not show the url as clickable link to be consistent with all other custom fields.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Go to Board -> Configure -> Card Layout.
2. Add a URL custom field to the layout.
3. On the rapidboard try to click on a link.
fields.summary: Do not show the value of the URL custom field as a clickable link on cards

fields.description: You're redirected to the issue navigator and good luck finding your way back. :)
fields.summary: Edit Filter Shares doesn't take you back to Configure Board

fields.description:
Hello,
We would like the Project Admin permission to be separate from the GHS permissions.
We do not want our scrum masters to create versions and components but they should be able to still create sprints and manage all aspects of the agile process.  

The problem with opening up all the project admin rights to scrum masters is that in a large project with lots of scrum masters the fields for components and fix version have become inconsistent due to lots of people being able to make changes.
fields.summary: Create Sprint and Sprint planning should not be tied to the Project Admin Permission

fields.description:
When assigning or re-assigning an Issue in the Work view, the focus of the board goes to the new Assignee part (Base Swimlanes on Assignee).

It would be great if the focus stays in the point where you were working from.
fields.summary: After assign an Issue, the focus of the Work View changes

fields.description:
I have several different projects going on and need to keep track of multiple time tracking reports to check up on velocity and goal fulfillment. 
I always end up having the differnt reports in tabs in my browser but figured I'd like to have these in my dashboard instead. 

The most interesting is the progress bars on progress and accuracy, 
(work estimated/finished and the accuracy percentage.)

Could this be made into a dashboard gadget? I would help out a lot!
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to have multiple time tacking report progress bars on my Dashboard as gadgets

fields.description:
[CHART] Time in Status Custom Field from JIRA Chart plugin is available to JIRA Agile even though this field has no valid value when displayed in Card Layout.

Expected behaviour:
Should not be available for selection on screen in JIRA Agile, since it's a Chart custom field.

Actual behaviour:
It's available for selection in JIRA Agile card layout.
fields.summary: [CHART] Time in status should not be available for selection in Card Layout

fields.description: Users do not like having to go in to each story on the board and set themselves as a watcher. They would rather have the ability to watch an entire board so they will get updates when a story is added, changed, etc. anywhere on the board. They were used to that functionality with LeanKit.
fields.summary: Ability to watch Kanban boards rather than watching individual cards / stories

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an Agile board includes a custom field that makes use of multi-select or Date/Time picker, and is then used in an Agile Dashboard Gadget, the field is displayed as HTML. When viewing the same board via Agile, the field appears as expected.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.5* (replicated on a Cloud instance)
* JIRA Agile - 6.7.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# *JIRA > System > Admin > Issues > Custom Fields*, *Create Custom Field*
# Select a *Field Type > Select List (multiple choices)*
# Add a title, and multiple options. Create.
# Assign to a screen. I chose the *Default Screen* on a test instance to make it easier.
# Create a test issue in a project that uses the screen you selected above.
# Go to *Agile > Manage Boards > Create Board*. Create a Kanban Board from the existing project. You may need to move your issue over to a column where you can see it.
# While on the board, click *Board > Configure > Card Layout*. Add your field, and go back to the board.
# Verify the custom field displays its results as expected.
# Nagivate to your Dashboard, and click *Add Gadget*. Add the *Agile Wallboard Gadget*, and select your new board.
# You will discover the custom field from the dashboard displays as HTML instead.

h3. Expected Results
The custom field should display as it does on the Agile board itself:

!Screen Shot 2015-05-19 at 3.30.14 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
Instead, the field uses HTML to display:

!Screen Shot 2015-05-19 at 3.32.08 PM.png|thumbnail!
* In case of Date/Time picker it will be displayed as '<span title=' 

h3. Notes
It's possible for other custom field types the same issue could occur.

h3.Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Using multi-select custom field on Agile Gadget in JIRA Dashboard displays as HTML

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-12071].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
In JIRA Agile 6.7 there is a new feature "LexoRank Management". 

This feature will be fantastic for users, as it prevents having to manually call REST endpoints when troubleshooting LexoRank issues.

h3. Environment
JIRA Agile 6.7.0 with compatible versions of JIRA. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Attempt to locate documentation on the LexoRank Management feature using Google or Confluence's search returns no relevant results. 

h3. Expected Results
There should be a document covering the basics of this feature and when to use it, the document should exist under: [JIRA Agile Administrator's Guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/JIRA+Agile+Administrator%27s+Guide]

h3. Actual Results
No results for the following query in the Agile 6.7 Space: https://confluence.atlassian.com/dosearchsite.action?queryString=LexoRank&startIndex=0&where=AGILE

h3. Notes
This feature replaces many of the manual rest calls covered in the Agile KB guides:
For Example:  [How To Fix Duplicate Rank Values For a Rank Field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/How+To+Fix+Duplicate+Rank+Values+For+a+Rank+Field]
fields.summary: The LexoRank Management User Interface is not documented

fields.description:
h3. Description:
Any user with permission to edit issues can close an Epic, even if there is still work remaining. On certain scenarios this is not desirable.

h3. Suggestion: 
Allow validators to restrict epics to be completed if there is remaining work on it.
fields.summary: Add validation when user tries to close Epics with incomplete stories

fields.description:
One of our scrum masters was tidying up his filters, and deleted several, one of which was in use by his scrum team's board.

This resulted in the board vanishing! Why was this allowed to happen? Surely some sort of warning or prevention could have been done by the system?

Our only fix was to recreate the board, and go through the settings to put everything back as it was. Not an easy time when you have developers in 2 countries trying to use the boards!

Please do something to prevent boards disappearing in this way.
fields.summary: Deleting filter = scrum board vanishes! ... Surely not?

fields.description:
Although it is the expected behavior of the Sub-Filter for Kanban boards as explained in its official documentation here :
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Configuring+Filters
{quote}
Adding a Sub-Filter for Kanban boards
A sub-filter refines the issues returned by your board's filter on Kanban boards. The sub-filter applies to the 'Kanban board' screen of the Kanban board only (i.e. not Reports). The sub-filter enables the Reports to show different data to Kanban board.
{quote}

It would be nice if there is an option for the user to include reports  when using sub-filter.
fields.summary: Option to Apply Sub-Filters to the Kanban Board Reports.

fields.description:
If an employee creates a private, or limited shared filter and maps it to a Board, administrators cannot see it.

When the employee leaves, we cannot delete that old board, or even know of its existence without poking into the database. We'd have to change the filter owner which is a pain, and then go back and remove the board.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to delete boards with private filters

fields.description: Starting and completing sprints are important milestones. They should generate HipChat notifications to let teams know about these events.
fields.summary: HipChat notification for sprint start/complete

fields.description: Have the ability to have Sub-Task included in a sprint without having its parent and siblings included in a sprint.
fields.summary: Subtask in a sprint

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
# In a SCRUM board, create multiple issues and select Epics/Assignees as the _Base Swimlane_
# Hold shift/CTRL button and select multiple issues from multiple different swimlanes. 

*Current Behavior:*
- Issues from different swimlane are not selected

*Expected Behavior:*
- Issues from different swimlane should be selected
fields.summary: Multiple selection in Active Sprints view does not work across swimlane

fields.description:
At the moment it's difficult to see just how many sprints are covered by the current backlog.  Also if you look at an issue in the backlog, you can't easily see which sprint it would fall into.

It would be great to see lines to separate groups of issues into "predicted" sprints.  So if you average velocity is 60pts, and the next 10 issues are 59pts with the 11th issue being more than 1 point, it would then draw a (dotted) line to indicate this could be a sprint, and then continue down the backlog until the end.

Perhaps this feature could be made simpler to implement if it was limited to a backlog that is not implementing multiple concurrent sprints.
fields.summary: Predicted sprint lines

fields.description:
Currently we have the development panel being displayed in the right side of the issue view screen.

As an user I would like to view the development panel in a different position, it would be nice if we had the ability to change the development panel position to the top or left in the issue screen view, or add it as a tab.
fields.summary: Ability to change the development panel position

fields.description: Most of my users consider it more valuable to know the name of the board instead of the board type (the board type is usually fairly obvious). Perhaps the board type should be in the collapsible nav instead of the board name. Or maybe both should display. It seems like there is probably room for both.
fields.summary: Show the board name instead of the board type when the left-nav is collapsed

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create two projects named A and B
# Create user named Bob
# In permissions for project A, give Bob permission to schedule issues, create and move issues. Do not give Bob this permission in project B.
# Log in as user Bob
# Create an issue in project A and drag it into a sprint that has not been started on the SCRUM board.
# Open the new issue you created and go to More >> Move. Move the issue to project B.
# Go back to the sprint for project A. Notice that the issue that was moved is still in the sprint. Bob will not have permission to remove it from the sprint and that will require someone with permissions to schedule issues in project B to remove the value of the Sprint field in that issue to remove it from the sprint in project A.

The desired behavior here is for there to be some special handling of sprints when moving issues. When an issue is moved to a project not covered by a SCRUM board's filter query (or some other way of identifying what is relevant to a sprint or not), it should also be removed from the sprint.
fields.summary: Moving an issue to another project does not remove issue from sprints

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, in the reports fro JIRA Agile, there are some aspects that are not covered, for example : 

* Members of the sprint team
* The issues assigned to the members
* The capacity of those team members

These information can be useful when planning the next sprint, as it would show whether or not the members of the team are overburdened and can finish their tasks on time

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great if there could be a report that can cover all the above, as well as integrate the information already shown in the Burndown Chart/Sprint Report. In total, the report should show all of these items :

* Members of the sprint team
* Issues assigned to those members
* Capacity of the team members
* The total estimate of the assigned issues
* The remaining estimate of the assigned issues

This report would be incredibly comprehensive and useful for planning and reporting
fields.summary: As an admin, I want the reports of JIRA Agile to be more comprehensive

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to create a new sprint on a Board that has a filter that is not restricted to any project, the sprint cannot be started even if the user has all correct Project Permissions (Administer Projects)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Board
# Edit the filter to: {{ORDER BY Rank ASC}}
# Make sure you have "Administer Project" permission for every project on the instance
# Click on "Create Sprint" from the board's Backlog section

h3. Expected Results
A new Sprint is created.

h3. Actual Results
An *Internal Server Error* window pops up
!errorcreatesprint.jpeg!

An error is shown in the Browser Console:
{noformat}

batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:206 ajax[37752891] error : {
successful  : false,
status      : 500,
statusText  : error,
hasData     : true,
readyState  : 4,
requestId   : 37752891,
aborted     : undefined,
}
{noformat}

Jira logs show error:
{noformat}

h3. Workaround:
Add at least one Project restriction to the Board's filter. e.g: {{project in (AB, CD) AND (the rest of the query without the SORT between parenthesis)}}
fields.summary: Unable to create new sprints when the board filter does not explicitly mention a project in it

fields.description:
As a user I'd like to be able see the issues in epic on the issue detail and have a possibility to use the "Create issue in Epic" functionality instead of the create subtask.

Additionally to be able to see the 'issue in epic' on the Card layout config similar to the subtask list.
fields.summary: create 'issue in epic' instead of a subtask on the issue detail view for epics type

fields.description:
A customer would like to reference a sprint in a bug report. Specifically, they were working without releases in pre-production, choosing to work via sprint only. Now that they've released to production, they are moving back to versioned releases but the request remains: How do I target a sprint that a "bug" occurred in?

This custom field isn't available for choosing.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I should be able to add a custom field of type "JIRA Agile Sprint Field"

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Have a JIRA Agile Scrum project created
# Have issue(s) with a completed sprint
!Screen Shot 2015-05-11 at 3.44.34 PM.png|thumbnail!
# Try to edit the issue
!Screen Shot 2015-05-11 at 3.45.48 PM.png|thumbnail!

*Expected Results:*
# Users should be able to update the issue without having to fill-out the sprint field.

*Actual Results:*
# The following error message shows up and *users are not able to edit/update the issue*.
{code}Sprint must exist: -1{code}
!Screen Shot 2015-05-11 at 3.46.00 PM.png|thumbnail!

*Add-on Version:*
JIRA Agile v6.7.1-D20
JIRA v6.5-OD-03

*Notes / Workaround:*
-This error doesn't occur if an active sprint is added to the _Sprint_ field when the issue is edited.-
*Update:* This error is occurring even if you select an active sprint.
fields.summary: Error message: Sprint must exist: -1

fields.description:
Security Token missing


JIRA could not complete this action due to missing form token
you may have cleared your browser cookies, whichk could have resulted in the expiry of your current form token. A new form token has been reissued.

"Retry Option" button displayed at the bottom
fields.summary: Not able to create EPIC/User Story

fields.description:
We have not made any changes to our workflows, but for some reason today, we are unable to move a ticket from Reviewing to Testing in our LD project. 

We also can't perform the following changes: 
From Ready to In Progress 
From Reopened to Reviewing. 
From In Progress to Reviewing 

We are receiving this error: 
"Could not load FunctionProvider class. 
It seems that you have tried to perform an illegal workflow operation. 
If you think this message is wrong, please contact your JIRA administrators." 

Please advise.
fields.summary: Unable to switch to certain statuses in Workflow

fields.description:
Just so you know, I tried to open this with Bitbucket (issue #11316) by following the links from the Jira Plugin "Quick Subtasks for Jira" issues web page (https://bitbucket.org/hascode/jira-quick-subtasks/issues?status=new&status=open), but Gary Sackett closed it the same day, and said to open it with Atlassian instead, which I did (JSP-230852). Then, I received an email from Shafinaz Elahi of Atlassian Support saying that I had once again opened it in the wrong place and gave me a link to a different place to open this, the link brought me here.  I hope this is the right place for this this time: 

This is for "Quick
Subtasks for Jira" plugin. 

We have 6 types of Sub tasks in our jira instance. In the Quick Subtasks plugin, it is documented that you can set the issuetype for a task by appending "/ issuetype:"Bugfix Subtask". But, when you go to add multiple subtasks, the dialog box has an issuetype drop-down
and can only be set to one value. If the issuetype is set by appending it to the text, the drop-down value always overrides it.

This causes the user to have to separately add their subtasks based on the issuetype instead of being able to add all of them in one go regardless of issuetype. Is this the intended functionality and the documentation is wrong, or is this a bug? It would be very beneficial if specifying the issuetype would override the drop-down value.

Thanks!

Mary =)
fields.summary: "Quick Subtasks for Jira" plugin enhancement request (or bug depending on how you look at it)

fields.description:
In agile boards, issues currently display a colored label of the epic they are assigned to, which also gets displayed in the sidebar under "Details: -> Epic:". 

However, this label is not clickable, so to navigate to the epic, you have to open the issue first, then click on the epic label where it indeed is a link.

Working on an epic label from the agile board this creates a lot of overhead.

!epic.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Epic Labels in Agile Board should be hyperlink to Epic

fields.description:
h3. Symptoms
Clicking on a non-admin project view causes a 500 error, with stack trace:

{noformat}
com.atlassian.cache.CacheException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: QueryLiteral 'null' must contain at least one non-null value
	at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCache$DelegatingLoadingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:306)
	at com.atlassian.cache.compat.delegate.DelegatingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:37)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.query.QueryToProjectMapper.getProjectContextIdsForQuery(QueryToProjectMapper.java:76)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.query.QueryServiceImpl.getProjectsForRapidView(QueryServiceImpl.java:114)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.query.QueryServiceImpl.getExplicitProjectsForRapidViewFilterQuery(QueryServiceImpl.java:101)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rapid.ProjectRapidViewServiceImpl.findRapidViewsByProject(ProjectRapidViewServiceImpl.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.sidebar.ProjectBoardsHelper.getProjectBoards(ProjectBoardsHelper.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.sidebar.BoardScopeFilterContextProviderImpl.getContext(BoardScopeFilterContextProviderImpl.java:34)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.sidebar.AgileBoardScopeFilterContextProvider.getContext(AgileBoardScopeFilterContextProvider.java:27)

	at com.atlassian.jira.projects.context.ProjectContextPopulator.populateWithProject(ProjectContextPopulator.java:44)
	at com.atlassian.jira.projects.page.ProjectPageServlet.getPluginProvidedDefaultPage(ProjectPageServlet.java:166)
	at com.atlassian.jira.projects.page.ProjectPageServlet.selectItemToRender(ProjectPageServlet.java:121)
	at com.atlassian.jira.projects.page.ProjectPageServlet.doGet(ProjectPageServlet.java:97)
{noformat}

Also: 

{noformat}
com.google.template.soy.tofu.SoyTofuException: In template JIRA.Templates.Projects.browseTabs: When evaluating "length($operationLinks)": Error while computing function "length($operationLinks)": Argument to length() function is not SoyListData.
com.google.template.soy.tofu.SoyTofuException: In template JIRA.Templates.Projects.browseTabs: When evaluating "length($operationLinks)": Error while computing function "length($operationLinks)": Argument to length() function is not SoyListData.
at com.google.template.soy.tofu.internal.BaseTofu.renderMainHelper(BaseTofu.java:341)
at com.google.template.soy.tofu.internal.BaseTofu.renderMain(BaseTofu.java:300)

at com.atlassian.soy.impl.DefaultSoyManager.render(DefaultSoyManager.java:118)
{noformat}

h3. Steps to reproduce (this might be specific to JIRA Agile)
# create cascading select and associate it to projects/issues
# Create a filter that includes <fieldname> in cascadeOption(None)
# Base Agile board on this filter
# Everything breaks (trying to view any project will fail)

h3. Workaround

Delete offending filter, do not use cascadeOption(None) in JQL queries
fields.summary: Using cascadeOption(None) in filter query breaks browse project view for all projects

fields.description:
At the moment, we can only map Statuses to Columns in Rapid Boards. However it would be great if we can map custom fields to columns as well

The use case scenario would be the following
# A project is managed by departments based on it's status
#* eg. All statuses managed by Support but the *In Progress* status would be managed by Developers
# The Dev will work on the issue (multiple stages in this step) but it's status will maintain at *In Progress* until they release the issue (transition to next status)

By allowing custom fields to be mapped by columns, the issue will stay at In Progress throughout the time Dev is working, but they have their own Kanban board to manage the issues in columns. This way, support can easily track the status of the issue
fields.summary: Ability to map custom field to board
Testing High priority scenarios

fields.description:
It would be nice if there is an option to configure the column constrain per assignee. 

An example scenario is where i want to prevent one developer to have more than two issues In Progress.

!col.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Column Constraint per assignee

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the Agile Issue View, the Development Panel would show development information related to that issue that comes from various Atlassian tools (like Fisheye, Stash, Crucible, etc). However, information that comes directly from Subversion is not reflected in the detail view at all. 

h3. Suggested Solution
 
It would be great if the information from Subversion can be shown in the Issue View of Agile as well.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to see Subversion related commits in the Agile Issue View

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-12029].
  {panel}

Currently JIRA Agile does not allow adding an epic to a sprint, that is, it is not possible to drag an epic into a sprint. However, from the view issue page of the Epic, it is possible to edit the sprint field and add a value to it, thereby causing problems like [GHS-12022|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-12022]

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an Epic.
2. Open the Epic's view issue page.
3. Edit the sprint field and add a value to it.
fields.summary: It should not be possible to add a value to the sprint field of Epic in the View Issue page

fields.description:
As a user of JIRA I would like the burn down chart to also plot a line representing the number of sub-tasks which are not yet done. For many sprints that have sub-tasks, the number of story points only starts to go down near the end of the sprint, e.g. due to testing that can only commence after development has been done first.

To match the scale of the story points, each sub-task would be reported as the number of story points for that user story divided by the number of sub-tasks for that user story. Stories without any sub-tasks would be reported as a single sub-task with the same amount of story points. Implementing this would give more insight of when progress is being made in a sprint.
fields.summary: Show sub-tasks in burn down

fields.description: Please can you add the assignee icon to a  parent issue in the swimlane so that I can easily scan the taskboard
fields.summary: As a Scrum user could i see a parent issue's assignee icon in the swimlane

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
Using the default "jira.date.picker.java.format" and "jira.date.picker.javascript.format", no warning is being displayed and the Control chart is updated accordingly. 
!bug_1.jpg|thumbnail!
!bug_2.jpg|thumbnail!

However, using the format that you have provided, incorrect warning message is being displayed and the chart is not updated when choosing any date from the date picker field. 
!bug_3.jpg|thumbnail!
!bug_4.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JAVA Date Picker Format doesn't Update the Agile Chart

fields.description:
Currently the Sprint workload summary, or the Workload by assignee is listed in [JIRA Agile 6.6 Release Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/JIRA+Agile+6.6+Release+Notes] and briefly touched on in [Using the Backlog|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Using+the+Backlog] but doesn't actually list what it does.

It _looks_ like it just takes estimates from the parent issue, and doesn't include sub-task estimates which can modify the overall estimate for the issue.

Please update the docs so it has more information on how this works, thanks. :)
fields.summary: Add some documentation for the 'Sprint workload summary' feature

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When starting a sprint, it may be necessary to remove a story from the sprint. When doing so, this should remove any points that were associated with that story from the project.

h3. Environment
Server
Cloud 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Story
# Assign Story points to the new Story
# Create a new Sprint
# Add the Story to the Sprint
# Start the Sprint
# Remove the Story from the Sprint
# End the Sprint
# Run the Epic Burndown Chart Report


h3. Expected Results
The Epic Burndown Chart should be displayed without including the Story Points associated with the Story that was removed from the Sprint


h3. Actual Results
The Epic Burndown Chart will be displayed with the Story Points associated with the Story that was removed from the Sprint


h3.Workaround
There is no current work around for this behavior
fields.summary: Deleting a story in a sprint should remove those estimates entirely

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When user has a lot of planned sprints ( 30-40 ) on the Backlog, the user is not able to send to view all the sprints when the user right clicks an issue from the backlog to send the selected issue to the appropriate sprint. 

!scroll.png|thumbnail!

h3. Environment
* JIRA Agile
* JIRA

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1.	Create 30- 40 sprints on agile board
2.	In backlog mode, right click on any backlog 
3.	List of Planned sprints will pop up
4.	Some of the Sprints on pop up will spill beyond the screen (see the attached, send to and some sprints are hidden)
5.	Scroll up to select sprint which is hidden, scroll doesn’t work

h3. Expected Results
1. Should be able to scroll up and down the long menu

h3. Actual Results
!scroll.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
{panel:title=When using the *New Jira Experience*|borderColor=#ccc|titleBGColor=#A1E6D9|bgColor=#F2F7FB}
When using the New Jira Experience the output of this bug is a little bit different. The more sprints you have, the upper the list will be in the screen. See the video for more details.

 [^720p.mov] 

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

{panel}

h3.Solution / Workaround
* Resize the browser window to 75%. For example , in Google Chrome i re-sized the browser to 75% by using they keyboard shortcut {{ctrl '-' '+'}} .
!scroll2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Cannot scroll long list of right click menu on Agile Backlog

fields.description:
Now that JIRA Core has [Auditing in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Auditing+in+JIRA], we'd like to see JIRA Software (formerly known as JIRA Agile) changes written to the audit log.

Currently events that involve changes in JIRA Core (ie filter changes) will be written, however not board changes, such as modifying columns or starting / stopping sprints.
fields.summary: As an administrator I would like JIRA Software to utilise the Audit Log
The "Epic Link" field list Epics from all the projects instead of the current one
Ability to add a set of dates as non-working days

fields.description:
Hi,

We are using JIRA 6.4. For some of our customers, we are using parallel sprints which we name for example "JMP - Sprint 22A" and "JMP - Sprint 22B". I could have issues assigned to me in either sprint, both of which run in parallel at the same time.

I built a filter for "Issues assigned to me" which I use in one of the gadgets on my dashboard. It looks like this:

assignee = currentUser() AND issuetype != Epic AND sprint in openSprints() AND resolution = Unresolved ORDER BY updatedDate DESC

However, for each of my projects, it only returns issues that are in the first parallel sprint, but not in the second. Instead of  "AND sprint in openSprints()" I tried using "AND sprint ~ JMP" as well as "AND sprint = JMP*", but neither one works.

Is the first mentioned problem a known bug?

Thanks,
Martin
fields.summary: JQL in openSprints() doesn't find issues in 2nd parallel sprint

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It is possible to close a parent issue (set to done) with open sub-tasks. When a user attempts to close a Sprint with these issues, a generic error occurs:

!sprint_closure2.jpg|thumbnail!

{quote}Sprint cannot be completed as there are incomplete subtasks on the following issues:{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution
If there is a closed parent issue with open sub-tasks, it should give the user the option to either move all sub-tasks to *done*, or re-open the parent issue.
 
h3. Workaround 
Re-open the parent issue *or* close the sub-tasks using Bulk Change operations
fields.summary: Unable to close Sprint with closed parent issue and open sub-tasks

fields.description: As a project manager I want to be able to define column constraints based on JQL: In its current version issue count is too restrictive. Instead I want to be able do define a query. The min and max should be defined as the number of items returned by that query.
fields.summary: Kanban Board column constraint based on JQL
Rank should consider Sprints

fields.description:
Currently you'll need to specify the Sprint ID when making bulk changes to the Sprint field.

(i) See [JIRA Agile: How to search for a Sprint using JQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/JIRA+Agile%3A+How+to+search+for+a+Sprint+using+JQL] for details on how to get the sprint ID
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to specify the Sprint Name during bulk edit operations

fields.description:
It’s only possible to select a single fixVersion when viewing the Release Burndown report.

Users would like to select multiple versions so they can better manage releases which contain work items from multiple projects.

Another solution would be implementing https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-8487
fields.summary: Multiple versions in Release Burndown report

fields.description:
*Summary*
When configuring swimlanes inside of JIRA Agile, JQL can be used to display issues. These JQL entries allow for inline editing. When editing the JQL for a swimlane while using Chrome or FireFox, the previously entered JQL remains visible. When doing the same in IE11, the JQL disappears. The JQL should remain as to provide a visual reference to the query they previously had entered.


*Steps to reproduce*
# Select an Agile Project
# Click the 'Board' button in the upper right hand corner of the board
# Select 'Configure' from the dropdown menu
# Click 'Swimlanes' in the left hand menu
# Click on any of the JQL present for any of the swimlanes present


*Workaround*
When editing the JQL for a swimlane, use either Chrome or FireFox.
fields.summary: JQL disappears from swimlane configuration when using IE11
